thread.title: Great bang for buck, and well-located, to boot! - Review
thread.title_full: Great bang for buck, and well-located, to boot! - Review of Seafarers & International House, New York City, NY - TripAdvisor

author: Steven C
title: Great bang for buck, and well-located, to boot! - Review
text:
Before saying anything else, let me note that not only have I stayed at Seafarers & International House but, as my former company has offices just three blocks away, I've lodged a number of travelers there. So, I probably have a broader perspective than most.
There's a lot to love about about the place. While the hotel is plain and the rooms are tiny... everything is clean and fresh, and the staff is friendly. Plus, the price is generally one of the lowest in the city. As the hotel is a Lutheran mission, there is another an obvious benefit to the traveler: no tax. This may not seem like a big deal until you consider the following.
New York State Sales Tax = 4%
New York City Sales Tax (4.5%) and Transportation District Surcharge (.375%) = 4.875%
Hotel Room Occupancy Tax = $2 + 5.875%
Additional Daily Fee = $1.50
Also, located just one east-west block (i.e., long block) from Union Square, not only one of NYC's cooler areas (with lots of great restaurants within a 10 minute walk) but also a major train hub. The following trains pass through the station:
4, 6, L, N, and Q trains at all times
5 and R trains at all times except late nights
W train on weekdays
You'd be hard-pressed to find a better deal in New York. The hardest part is getting a room, as availability can not be counted upon.
